who_we_are.title: Who We Are
who_we_are.description: The Deravasi Mahajan community emerged nearly two centuries ago when members of the Kutchi Visa Oswal Jain community settled in South Mumbai. Their unity and shared values laid the foundation for a strong community.

what_we_do.title: What We Do
what_we_do.description: We serve through a blend of spiritual, social, and educational initiatives that promote Jain values and uplift lives. Together, we strengthen religious practices, provide cultural guidance, and support social and economic welfare for our community.

content.description1: The roots of Deravasi Mahajan go back several generations, when visionary leaders came together with wisdom and courage. Over the years, the Mahajan has grown not only in numbers but also in purpose – from supporting families in times of need to organising festivals, building temples, and creating opportunities for learning and growth.
content.description2: This journey is not just history; it is a living example of what a united community can achieve when faith and service go hand in hand.

organised.title: How We're Organised
organised.description: To improve our reach and effectiveness across Mumbai, independent committees were formed, led by trustees, volunteers, and community leaders. This structure allows us to work better, stay focused, and serve with purpose.

landmarks.title: Our Landmarks – Hubs of Heritage & Service
landmarks.description: Our legacy continues through community centres that inspire and support:
items: Adinath Jin Temple, Kutchi Bhavan, Palitana
Orchid The International School (KVOS Jain High School), Palagamle

cta.title: Looking Ahead
cta.description: We remain committed to preserving our values—service, unity, and culture—just as our founders did. Today, we continue to nurture that tradition while inspiring upcoming generations to grow with pride, empathy, and connection.
